duties_responsibilities.duty: Internalize youth engagement curriculum and lessons to proficiently facilitate them for an audience.
Execute youth engagement lessons in K12 schools and with youth and their families.
Record student engagement and post-test data in shared tracker to support impact tracking.
Maintain a calendar of engagement activities including school workshops, community events, and other engagement opportunities.
Develop partnerships with local schools, community-based organizations, and other related entities with shared or aligned missions.
Coordinate the participation of volunteers in office programming as needed.
Track engagement metrics and provide regular reports on impact.
Execute youth engagement lessons using Office curriculum and resources in community spaces.
Table at community events to increase awareness of the Office and distribute relevant resources to youth and their families.
Recruit and support volunteers and other TAMU-affiliated staff to become active partners in the Office’s youth engagement work.
Maintain a regional social media account on behalf of the Office for Youth Engagement and use it to raise community awareness of resources and programs.
Provide feedback on curriculum and resources to improve them.
Make recommendations related to new content and resources to be developed.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree in Education or a related field (Master’s preferred)
Class “C” vehicle operator’s license or ability to obtain within 30 days of employment.
